title: Practice Challenge
description:
Simulate a CI/CD pipeline:

1. Create a `CIPipeline` class that:
   - Runs steps in order (checkout, install, test, build, deploy)
   - Stops if any step fails
   - Shows timing for each step
   - Only deploys if on 'main' branch

2. Simulate running the pipeline with both passing and failing tests
instructions:
Simulate a CI/CD pipeline:

1. Create a `CIPipeline` class that:
   - Runs steps in order (checkout, install, test, build, deploy)
   - Stops if any step fails
   - Shows timing for each step
   - Only deploys if on 'main' branch

2. Simulate running the pipeline with both passing and failing tests

testCases.description: Should stop pipeline on failed tests

hints.text: Use a 'failed' flag to skip remaining steps when a step fails

commonMistakes.consequence: Broken code gets deployed to production.
commonMistakes.correction: Add 'needs: test' to the deploy job so it only runs after tests pass.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using npm instead of bun in CI
commonMistakes.consequence: CI runs 10x slower, wasting time and money.
commonMistakes.correction: Use oven-sh/setup-bun@v2 and bun commands for faster builds.

commonMistakes.consequence: Secrets are exposed in your public repository.
commonMistakes.correction: Use ${{ secrets.SECRET_NAME }} and add secrets in GitHub Settings.
